title: Zborov nad Bystricou
text:
Zborov nad Bystricou is a <a href="village">village</a> and <a href="municipality">municipality</a> in <a href="%C4%8Cadca%20District">Čadca District</a> in the <a href="%C5%BDilina%20Region">Žilina Region</a> of northern <a href="Slovakia">Slovakia</a>.
History.
In <a href="history">historical records</a> the <a href="village">village</a> was first mentioned in 1662.
Before 1918 the official name was Felsozboró, or only Zboró. The total population in 1910 was 1,607 which included mostly Roman Catholic Slovaks. The region was devastated by the attacks of Tartars in the 13th century and the first settlers came here after 1400AD (Stara Bystrica). Zborov nad Bystricou were founded by the Valach colonists in the 15th century.
Geography.
The <a href="municipality">municipality</a> lies at an <a href="altitude">altitude</a> of 420 metres and covers an <a href="area">area</a> of 18.709 km². It has a <a href="population">population</a> of about 2290 people.
